caption:
Table 2: Statistics of the MTmC4 corpus. ? indicates 
that the language is used in DOCmT5-5.

Table 3: Results of four seen langauges paris {Es, Tr, Ru, Vi} on Wikilingua. Each cell demonstrates three metrics: 
ROUGE-1, ROUGE-2 and ROUGE-L in order. The mBART results are taken from the GEM(Gehrmann et al.,  2021) paper for a strong baseline model.
Table 4: Results of three unseen langauges paris {Fr, Id, Hi} on Wikilingua.

Table 4. We use three languages {Fr, Id, Hi} 3 . 
Once again, we see that the Dr objective brings 
substantial improvements over cont-5langs. Sur-
prisingly, without directly pretraining on the same 
language pairs, DOCmT5-5 leads to substantial im-
provements over strong baselines. This shows that 
our pretraining objectives are able to generalize to 
other languages. DOCmT5-25 pretrains on French 
and Hindi but not Indonesian and hence we observe 
improvements of average results over DOCmT5-5. 
The improvements of DOCmT5 are not so substan-
tial and sometimes even hurt performance in high-
resource languages: French and Indonesian, which 
have 44556 and 33237 training examples respec-
tively and there are only 6942 examples in Hindi. 
DOCmT5-25-Large obtains the best results in al-
most all 3 languages except for French.
Table 5: Finetuning results on WMT20 De-En.

Table 6: Unseen language pair results on IWSLT 
2015 Zh-En. Chinese is in the second-stage pretrain-
ing language set of DOCmT5-25 but not in those of 
DOCmT5-5. DOCmT5-25-Large achieves SOTA.

Table 7: Document translation without finetuning on 
WMT20 De-En, Ru-En, Pl-En and Ja-En.

Table 8. We see that document-level models of-
fer small improvements on summarization and very 
significant improvements on document-level trans-
lation, showing that the longer context is indeed 
useful.

Table 8: SenTLM and DocTLM finetuning results on 
WMT20 De-En.

Table 9: Methods of combining mono-lingual and 
cross-lingual and their finetuning results on WMT20 
De-En and IWSLT15 Zh-En.
